Comments_List: Great insights into the thinking that has been done on all the different influences on voting. There was good practice with interpreting a lot of quantitative work that was at the right level - for me anyway - to be able to learn from, critique and develop skills with.

The course feels really well-developed already. It felt like a syllabus that had been honed over time. One area might be to change the weekly presentation format - I wasn't sure that it was working to the benefit of the quality of general class discussion.

Yes. Anyone interested in American voters in politics, rather than say, the presidents, parties or governments, should take this. And the literatures transfer well to considering voting in other democratic countries too.

YES. Take this class. The syllabus is wonderful, and there are extra readings beyond what is required. John is incredibly supportive, so start your final paper early and you'll have a great time working on it!
